New Hudson Line Timetable Effective October 3

Our New Hudson Line schedule effective Saturday, October 3 continues to provide you with a safe and reliable service while accommodating our program of aggressive improvements along our right-of-way. Hudson Line customers should use the new timetable beginning on Saturday, October 3. The prior timetable with the end date of October 3 will no longer be in effect. Key changes to look for: We are doing major switch replacement at a location in the Bronx near Yankee Stadium which will require a Special Weekend Construction Schedule to be in effect from Saturday, October 3 – Sunday, November 15. Most of this work will be done during off-peak hours and on weekends in order to minimize any impact on your commute. On weekends, customers traveling from points north of Croton-Harmon will need to make an across-platform change of trains at Croton-Harmon. New New Haven & Harlem Line Timetables Effective October 4

New Harlem & New Haven Line schedules effective Sunday October 4 continue to provide you with a safe and reliable service while accommodating our program of aggressive improvements along our right-of-way. See more details at http://bit.ly/1EVLb9i New timetables will be available in Grand Central, at outlying station ticket offices, on our schedules page at http://bit.ly/1arccwk, or on our Train Time App (http://bit.ly/1s3fjbQ).
New Hudson Line Timetable Effective October 3

Our New Hudson Line schedule effective Saturday, October 3 continues to provide you with a safe and reliable service while accommodating our program of aggressive improvements along our right-of-way. Hudson Line customers should use the new timetable beginning on Saturday, October 3. The prior timetable with the end date of October 3 will no longer be in effect. Key changes to look for: We are doing major switch replacement at a location in the Bronx near Yankee Stadium which will require a Special Weekend Construction Schedule to be in effect from Saturday, October 3 - Sunday, November 15. Most of this work will be done during off-peak hours and on weekends in order to minimize any impact on your commute. On weekends, customers traveling from points north of Croton-Harmon will need to make an across-platform change of trains at Croton-Harmon. New Hudson Line Timetable Effective October 3

Our New Hudson Line schedule effective Saturday, October 3 continues to provide you with a safe and reliable service while accommodating our program of aggressive improvements along our right-of-way. Hudson Line customers should use the new timetable beginning on Saturday, October 3. The prior timetable with the end date of October 3 will no longer be in effect. Key changes to look for: We are doing major switch replacement at a location in the Bronx near Yankee Stadium which will require a Special Weekend Construction Schedule to be in effect from Saturday, October 3 – Sunday, November 15. Most of this work will be done during off-peak hours and on weekends in order to minimize any impact on your commute. On weekends, customers traveling from points north of Croton-Harmon will need to make an across-platform change of trains at Croton-Harmon. New Hudson Line Timetable Effective October 3

Our New Hudson Line schedule effective Saturday, October 3 continues to provide you with a safe and reliable service while accommodating our program of aggressive improvements along our right-of-way. Key changes to look for: - We are doing major switch replacement at a location in the Bronx near Yankee Stadium which will require a Special Weekend Construction Schedule to be in effect from Saturday, October 3 – Sunday, November 15. Most of this work will be done during off-peak hours and on weekends in order to minimize any impact on your commute. - Weekday schedules will feature minimal service changes. See full details at http://bit.ly/1EVLb9i New timetables will be available in Grand Central, at outlying station ticket offices, on our schedules page at http://bit.ly/1arccwk or on our Train Time App (http://bit.ly/1s3fjbQ).

Buy Round-Trip Tickets for Travel During Papal Visit

LIRR Travel Info for Pope Francis' NYC Visit

LIRR plans to operate normal train service to/from Penn Station during the Pope's visit. Certain entrances, exits and stairways at Penn Station will be closed for security reasons. The LIRR's 34th St. Entrance and Amtrak's entrance at 32nd St. & 7th Ave. are expected to remain open. Customers should expect heavier than normal volume at these access points.

Metro-North Service for Pope Francis Visit for Today Sept. 25th

Metro-North Service for Pope Francis Visit for today Sept. 25th Pope Francis will have a full schedule of events across the city today Friday, Sept. 25, including afternoon Mass at Madison Square Garden. Customers are advised to buy round-trip tickets in advance and expect crowded conditions: The railroad will operate three additional inbound trains, while some trains will make extra stops and others will be cancelled. Currently there are no combined or cancelled trains set for the evening period, however, customers should listen for PA announcements in the event of any last-minute changes to their commute. See full details at http://bit.ly/1Mhks6Z

LIRR Travel Info for Pope Francis' NYC Visit

LIRR plans to operate normal rush hour train service to/from Penn Station during the Pope's visit; with extra off-peak trains added on Friday, Sept. 25. Some entrances, exits and stairways at Penn Station will be closed for security reasons. The LIRR's 34th St. Entrance and Amtrak's entrance at 32nd St. & 7th Ave. are expected to remain open. Expect heavier than normal volume at these access points and allow extra travel time.

Metro-North Service for Pope Francis’ Visit Sept. 24 - 25

Pope Francis will arrive in New York on Thursday, Sept. 24, and will have a full schedule of events across the city on Friday, Sept. 25, including afternoon Mass at Madison Square Garden. Customers are advised to buy round-trip tickets in advance and expect crowded conditions: On Thursday, Sept. 24, Metro-North will run a normal schedule, as ridership projections are modest and can be accommodated by existing service. On Friday, Sept. 25, the railroad will operate three additional inbound trains, while some trains will make extra stops and others will be cancelled. Currently there are no combined or cancelled trains set for the evening period, however, customers should listen for PA announcements in the event of any last-minute changes to their commute. See full details at http://bit.ly/1Mhks6Z

New NJ Transit Fares Effective October 1

The NJ TRANSIT fare increase set for Thursday, October 1, will bring slight increases to monthly fares for customers who transfer at Secaucus Junction for NJ TRANSIT service to Penn Station-NY of: a $6 increase for Port Jervis customers and a $4 increase for Pascack Valley customers. There will be no impact on Port Jervis and Pascack Valley Line customers (except those travelling from Suffern) who currently commute to Hoboken Terminal. Additionally, fares for our Train to the Game Meadowlands service will also increase by 25 cents for the one-way fare and by 50 cents for the round-trip fare. For more details, including new fares, visit http://bit.ly/1US2qzB

The pedestrian overpass at the east end of Mineola Station will close for renovations starting Tuesday September 22. Customers may use the Mineola Boulevard overpass or the overpass in the middle of the platform while the work is being performed. The renovation is expected to be completed in November.

7 Line – UPDATED Weekday Planned Service Changes

The following planned service changes are ADDED: 10:15 AM to 3 PM, Tuesday, Sep 22 Hudson Yards-bound 7 service runs express from 74 St-Broadway to Queensboro Plaza. To 69 St, 52 St, 46 St, 40 St, and 33 St, take the Hudson Yards-bound 7 to 61 St-Woodside or Queensboro Plaza and transfer to a Main St-bound 7. From these stations, take a Main St-bound 7 to 61 St-Woodside or 74 St-Broadway and transfer to a Hudson Yards-bound 7. 10:15 AM to 3 PM, Wednesday, Sep 23 Hudson Yards-bound 7 service runs express from Willets Point to 74 St-Broadway. To 111 St, 103 St, 90 St, and 82 St, take the Hudson Yards-bound 7 to Junction Blvd or 74 St-Broadway and transfer to a Main St-bound 7. From these stations, take a Main St-bound 7 to Junction Blvd or Willets Point and transfer to a Hudson Yards-bound 7.

The pedestrian overpass at the east end of Mineola Station will close for renovations starting Tuesday September 22. The renovations will include new stair treads and supports, paint and new window panels. Customers may use the Mineola Boulevard overpass or the overpass in the middle of the platform while the work is being performed. The renovation is expected to be completed in November.

Early-Morning Montauk Train Will Not Stop at Hicksville Sun., Sept. 20

The 1:10AM train from Jamaica to Montauk will not stop at Hicksville on Sunday morning. Those normally boarding this train at Hicksville at 1:29 AM for travel to Montauk Branch stations, will be provided with bus service this weekend. Those who use this train to travel from Jamaica to Hicksville can instead take the 12:36 AM from Jamaica to Ronkonkoma; or the 1:34 AM from Jamaica to Huntington.
Early-Morning Montauk Train Will Not Stop at Hicksville Sat. & Sun., Sept. 19-20

To accommodate overnight trackwork this weekend, the 1:10AM train from Jamaica to Montauk will not stop at Hicksville on Saturday & Sunday morning. This train will instead operate express to Babylon along the south shore. Pick up the Special Montauk Branch Timetable Card dated Sept. 19-20 or see http://bit.ly/1W5XB2X.
Bus Replaces Overnight Train Between Jamaica and Hicksville Sept 19-20

Due to overnight trackwork, buses will replace the 2:10AM train from Jamaica to Hicksville on Sat. & Sun., Sept. 19 & 20. Customers at Jamaica & Mineola will board buses to Hicksville, where those traveling further east will connect to an eastbound train. Plan for 40 minutes additional travel time. See special Port Jefferson Branch timetable card or http://bit.ly/1YhAVPc.

Connect With Us: Metro-North Customer Forums Start Sept. 17

Our informal 2015 Customer Forums provide for two-way dialogue between Metro North and our customers. We are holding these sessions in Grand Central Terminal and outlying stations to gather your input about our service. First forums take place this Thursday, Sept. 17 in Grand Central outside the Station Masters Office from 7 AM – 9 AM and 4 PM – 6 PM See more details and a list of upcoming forums at http://bit.ly/1Lw5xmz

Anticipate Delays For Wednesday AM Rush

Customers should anticipate delays for AM rush Wednesday, 9/16, due to the NY&AR freight derailment west of Hicksville Tuesday. LIRR personnel are working around-the-clock to re-rail the derailed freight cars and repair hundreds of feet of damaged track and third rail. Wednesday morning service will mirror Tuesday evening's; there may be no eastbound train service to Ronkonkoma, Huntington or Port Jefferson from 6-10 AM. New Port Jervis and Pascack Valley Line Schedules Effective Sunday, September 13

Major changes to look for include: - On the Port Jervis Line, a new weekday mid-day train departs Hoboken at 2:41 PM (Penn Station-NY at 2:29 PM) and arrives at Middletown at 4:19 PM. To make room for this addition, the 1:13 PM train to Middletown now departs Hoboken at 12:42 PM (Penn Station-NY at 12:37 PM). - On the Pascack Valley Line a new late night weekday train now departs Hoboken at 11:13 PM (Penn Station-NY at 11:06 PM), arriving in Spring Valley at 12:23 AM. This train operates 30 minutes later and replaces the 10:42 PM train from Hoboken (10:35 PM from Penn Station-NY). Due to NJ TRANSITs decision, the last outbound weekday train (departing Hoboken at 12:45 AM) will no longer operate Monday-Thursday nights. As an alternative, late-night services are available from Coach USA and Tappan ZEExpress. See full details at http://bit.ly/1IJxUM3. New timetables are available at Hoboken Terminal, Penn Station-NY and Secaucus Junction, or you can view them at www.njtransit.com

New Port Jervis and Pascack Valley Line Schedules Effective Sunday, September 13

Major changes to look for include: - On the Port Jervis Line, a new weekday mid-day train departs Hoboken at 2:41 PM (Penn Station-NY at 2:29 PM) and arrives at Middletown at 4:19 PM. To make room for this addition, the 1:13 PM train to Middletown now departs Hoboken at 12:42 PM (Penn Station-NY at 12:37 PM). - On the Pascack Valley Line a new late night weekday train now departs Hoboken at 11:13 PM (Penn Station-NY at 11:06 PM), arriving in Spring Valley at 12:23 AM. This train operates 30 minutes later and replaces the 10:42 PM train from Hoboken (10:35 PM from Penn Station-NY). Due to NJ TRANSITs decision, the last outbound weekday train (departing Hoboken at 12:45 AM) will no longer operate Monday – Thursday nights. As an alternative, late-night services are available from Coach USA and Tappan ZEExpress. See full details at http://bit.ly/1IJxUM3. New timetables are available at Hoboken Terminal, Penn Station-NY and Secaucus Junction, or you can view them at www.njtransit.co

Customers must hold onto their LIRR tickets and have them ready for presentation/collection upon exiting the train at Mets-Willets Point Station. See http://bit.ly/1LsMps0 for details.

Ronkonkoma Branch W/B Midday Departure Times Changing Sept. 8

Following completion of summer trackwork that required adjustments to westbound midday train departure times, midday off-peak trains will revert to their previous schedules starting Tues., Sept. 8. As a result, midday off-peak trains will depart 30 minutes earlier or 30 minutes later. Pick up the new Sept. 8 Ronkonkoma Branch timetable or see http://bit.ly/1tWgHKc.
Danbury Branch Service is currently experiencing delays of up to 20 minutes due to mechanical difficulties. Please listen for announcements at your station.
New Far Rockaway Br. Timetable in Effect Sept. 8

The Far Rockaway-bound train that departs Atlantic Terminal at 12:14AM seven days a week will be adjusted one minute earlier. As of Sept. 8, the train will depart at 12:13AM to accommodate construction of a new train yard in downtown Brooklyn. Pick up the new Far Rockaway Br. Sept. 8 Timetable or see http://bit.ly/1XndZgV.
Due to an earlier incident at 110 St, 1 train service has resumed with residual delays.
Port Jefferson Br. Trackwork to Begin Sept. 8

Starting Sept. 8, the departure times of all westbound weekday midday trains originating in Huntington, and some trains in both directions, will be adjusted between one minute earlier & four minutes later to allow for replacement of rail between Hicksville & Syosset. Pick up the new Port Jefferson Br. Sept. 8 Timetable or see http://bit.ly/1UvMNbx
New Port Washington Br. Timetables in Effect Sept. 8

Starting Sept. 8, departure times of weekday midday Port Washington Branch trains have been adjusted between one and three minutes later to allow for switch replacement near the Mets-Willets Point station. Pick up the new Port Washington Br. Sept. 8 Timetable or see http://bit.ly/1JCO5fH.
New Babylon Br. Timetables in Effect Sept. 8

Beginning Sept. 8, departure times for some weekday midday Babylon Branch trains have been adjusted between eight minutes earlier and 13 minutes later due to the Wantagh Station rehabilitation work and the completion of Massapequa Station rehabilitation work. Pick up the new Babylon Br. Sept. 8 Timetable or see http://bit.ly/11dMk9b.
Two Weekend Trains restored on Oyster Bay Br. Starting Sept. 12

Starting Sept. 12, the LIRR is restoring two weekend trains to the Oyster Bay Branch that were cut in 2010 because of budget constraints. On Sat. & Sun. mornings, a train will depart Jamaica at 1:46AM, making all stops to Oyster Bay. Additionally, a weekend train will depart Oyster Bay at 7:19AM, making all stops to Jamaica. Pick up the new Sept. 8 Timetable or see http://bit.ly/1EEnbYr.
Reverse-Peak Morning Stop Added at Mineola Starting Sept. 8

Starting Sept. 8, the 8:19AM train from Jamaica, due to Port Jefferson at 9:53AM will now stop at Mineola at 8:30AM, providing added reverse-peak service at Mineola. To allow for the new station stop, this train will depart Jamaica one minute earlier, at 8:18AM. Pick up the new Sept. 8 Timetable or see http://bit.ly/1UvMNbx.
New LIRR Schedules Take Effect Tuesday, Sept. 8

The new timetables include service improvements, schedule revisions to accommodate trackwork and bridge construction projects, and extra service for New York Islanders Games and other Barclays Center events. Pick up a copy of the new timetable for your branch or see http://bit.ly/1EEzeoD for details
